TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SchemaReference extends System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference

Docs.summary: Represents a reference in a discovery document to an XML Schema Definition (XSD) language schema. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks XML Web services discovery involves discovering the available XML Web services given, a URL. A The URL typically points to a discovery document, which usually has a.disco file name extension. The discovery document contains references to information about the existance of XML Web services. These references can refer to service descriptions, XSD schemas, or other discovery documents. This class represents a reference to an XSD schema.
Within a discovery document, a reference to an XSD schema is contained within a `schemaRef` XML element. The `schemaRef` XML element has an XML namespace and a `ref` attribute. The value of the XML namespace must match the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Namespace> constant. The value of the `ref` attribute is placed in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Ref%2A> property.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SchemaReference#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SchemaReference/CPP/schemareference.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SchemaReference#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SchemaReference/CS/schemareference.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SchemaReference#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SchemaReference/VB/schemareference.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: XML namespace for XSD schema references in discovery documents.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Within a discovery document, a reference to an XSD schema is contained within a `schemaRef` XML element, which is a part of the XML namespace specified in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Namespace> constant.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL to the referenced XSD schema.
Docs.value: The URL for the referenced XSD schema. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a discovery document, a reference to an XSD schema is contained within a `schemaRef` XML element. The `schemaRef` XML element has a `ref` attribute, which is the URL for the referenced XSD schema. The <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractReference.Ref%2A> property represents the value of the `ref` attribute.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SchemaReference#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SchemaReference/CPP/schemareference.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[SchemaReference#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SchemaReference/CS/schemareference.cs#2)] [!code-vb[SchemaReference#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SchemaReference/VB/schemareference.vb#2)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the XSD schema has not been downloaded and added to the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientProtocol.Documents%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference.ClientProtocol%2A>, an attempt to download and resolve the document is made.

## Remarks For the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference> class, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Url%2A> property returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Ref%2A> property.
